CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 30, 1955, pg. 11 reads: "Metoka Contestants-Scholarship contestants competing for the cash awards presented last Thursday at the annual Metoka Club's garden party are pictured above, some of them by proxy. Maurice Johnson was first-prize winner, with a total of $306.  He is a student at Carnegie Tech.  Mr. Johnson is pictured on the extreme left.  Others in the group include Mrs. Mary Johnson, who stood proxy for her daughter, Val Kay Johnson, Pennsylvania College for Women; Mrs. Selma Gilmore, proxy for Janice Gilmore, Hampton College; Beverly Smith, proxy for Margaret Smith; Clarence Burleigh, second-prize winner with the sum of $288, and student at University of Pittsburgh; Edna Louise Hill, University of Pittsburgh; Mary Lesesne, West Virginia State College; Lee Bertha West, University of Pittsburgh; Pearl Stern, proxy for Robert Russell; Ella Louise Sumpter, Edinboro STC, and Mrs. Howard Rodgers, proxy for third-prize winner Claire E. Rodgers, who brought in $207.  Miss Rodgers is a student at Northwest Institute, Minnesota.-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of two men and nine women scholarship contestants, first row from left: Maurice Johnson, Mary Johnson (proxy), Selma Gilmore (proxy), Beverly Smith, and Clarence Burleigh; second row: Edna Louise Hill, Mary Lesesne, and Lee Bertha West; back row: Pearl Stern (proxy), Ella Louise Sumpter, and Mrs. Howard Rodgers (proxy), standing in front of the Church of the Holy Cross for the Metoka Club's annual scholarship garden party
